isis.stitle: TSI 96-12-14 - Instructions to Install a T 444E Engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device

subjectgroup.subject: Instructions to Install a T 444E Engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 1000, 3000, and 4000 Series models with standard torque T 444E engines.

As recently announced, the engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device became standard equipment on all standard torque T 444E engines effective 7/15/96. This device will provide faster engine warm-up and will allow the engine to maintain higher engine temperatures during extended idling conditions in cold weather. It is also recommended that engine rpm be set at 1250 rpm using the Electronic Hand Throttle during extended idling conditions in cold weather. The engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device can be retrofitted to any standard torque T 444E engine (engine codes 12NHW, 12NHZ, 12NHX, 12NJA, 12NDX, and 12NHS). The engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device cannot be used on T 444E High Torque engines. Procedures for retrofitting an Electronic Hand Throttle can be found in TSI-96-12-15.

partsinfo.para: The following parts are required for equipping the T 444E engine with an exhaust back pressure device. This feature requires use of an ambient temperature sensor. An ambient temperature sensor already exists in vehicles built September 29, 1994 and later.

entry.para: Sensor IAT - Trucks Built Prior to 9/29/94
Harness, EBP Engine - Trucks Built Prior to 9/29/94
Harness, EBP Engine - Trucks Built After 9/29/94

partsinfo.para: Trucks built prior to 9/29/94 need a new air intake pipe unless the truck is equipped with an air compressor. If your truck is equipped with an air compressor, use a "T" fitting for sensor installation.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 96-12-14 - Instructions to Install a T 444E Engine Exhaust Back Pressure Device
svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Refer to TSI-94-08-05 for reprogramming procedures to turn on the Exhaust Back Pressure Device feature. If Tech Central assistance is required, call 1-800-336-4500.

Installation of the Exhaust Back Pressure Device (EBPD) can be performed on all engines except high torque ratings. Refer to the parts lists for required parts needed for installation of EBPD on your specific model and build date.

step1.para: Removal of the turbocharger - Refer to EGES 120 Section 2 page 5.
Removal of the turbo pedestal and exhaust outlet - Refer to EGES 120 Section 2 page 11.
Installation of the EBPD control valve and pedestal - Refer to EGES 120 Section 2 page 17.
Installation of the turbocharger - Refer to EGES 120 Section 2 page 18.

If required, install the new air intake pipe from the air cleaner to the turbo inlet. If the truck has an air compressor, remove the air compressor intake hose fitting from the air intake pipe and install T-fitting.
If required, install the new air temperature sensor in the air intake pipe.
Remove the plug on the front of the right exhaust manifold and install fitting 1822713C1.
Install EBP sensor bracket onto the top of the front cover high pressure reservoir.
Install the EBP sensor into the sensor bracket.
Install the EBP tube between the sensor bracket and the right hand exhaust manifold fitting.

On the IDM dash harness on the outside of the cab routing to the IDM, ECM, and the engine connector locate the EBPD harness breakout (6 pin connector 410) located below the "T" in the harness. Connect the EBPD overlay harness to this connector.
Route the EBPD overlay harness down inboard side of the left cylinder head and connect connector (411) to the EBP solenoid valve.
If required, connect connector (390) to the air temperature sensor located in the air intake pipe.
Routing the EBPD overlay harness on the left cylinder head, remove one of the glow plug controller mounting bolts and remove all paint from this surface and install eyelet for ground.
Route the overlay harness over the front cover high pressure reservoir and connect connector (409) to the EBPD sensor.
Secure harness in place and inspect routing to insure it is free of abrasions and obstructions.
Using a service tool (Pro-Link) turn the exhaust back pressure feature ON by one of the following steps that applies to the vintage of your vehicle.
Using the Pro-Link, scroll to the end of the data stream and determine your VPM Ver. #. This will indicate 2.000 or 2.001 and greater.

VPM Ver. 2000 will need a new password from Tech Central. Before calling, you will need to find the following information for Tech Central to give you a new password. 1. VPM s/n (This can be found at the end of the data stream) 2. ID # (This can be found at the end of the data stream) 3. Total tattle tales (This can be found in the password and audit menu).

VPM Ver. 2.001 and greater use four zeros (0000) for password. If this does not work, the password may have been reset by dealer or customer. Call Tech Central for VPM reprogramming if password cannot be found.
Test the operation of the exhaust back pressure device by performing the engine running diagnostic test.
Check and clear all codes when complete.
